file_content.text: One disaster averted. Now where are we on that sequencer?
The immediate threat has been quelled. However, this place will explode in exactly ten seconds... now.
I love the thrill of killing. Hope that wasn't our last.
It was either them or us. But we may have staved off death for only a few moments.
We fight like every kill is our last!
The reactor core will self-destruct in ten seconds....
Don't worry, we're not going to die.
It'll be alright.
If we die, we die.
Whatever happens, happens.
Eight... seven....
If there's something you want to say before the end, now's the time.
Got any last requests?
My mind's a blank. What do you know, I'm finally at a loss for words.
I just wish we'd had more time to be together.
Yeah, I got something. You are the biggest pile of crud in the galaxy.
It has been my distinct pleasure serving you, my lord.
I believe you know how I feel about you, my lord.
I feel we only just scratched the surface of our potential together.
You have opened me up to so much sensation and thrill. I am forever grateful.
You know I appreciate all you've done for me, Master.
We die like warriors, you and us.
Vault code sequence complete.
The reactor core will self-destruct in five seconds....
Vault lock disarming.
Four....
Vault door air lock releasing.
Three....
Vault open.
Hurry inside!
Right behind you, my lord!
Our enemies will pay for this!
Right behind you!
We kill now!
Don't have to tell me twice!
The vault is open! Resecure the vault before the reactor core explodes!
That was reckless, Sith. You could have killed us all.
I suppose this means my imposter turned tail. Stupid of me to entrust a grunt. I should have sacrificed my advisor here.
Your advisor will be dead in a few moments.
His life ends with yours.
He is unarmed. Are you such a coward you kill the defenseless?
You must be a joy to work for.
Some leader you are.
True patriots are ready to die for their leader.
All of this has been unnecessary.
What a waste.
I don't care what you're peddling, Sith.
Now that this reactor core has been detonated, the Empire can't duplicate Project Siantide.
As Frellka no doubt demonstrated, there is nothing more important than our project. I had no choice.
All your effort has been a waste. Siantide is out of your reach.
I'm not interested in your project, General. Just you and the other members of the War Trust.
You are my target.
Well, I am at your mercy, but the others are safely beyond your grasp.
General Durant and General Faraire are working to make Project Siantide a success. They are close to achieving working prototypes!
No threat or torture will get me to compromise their locations.
If you're not going to be useful, I'll just kill you.
Then you die. [Kill Minst]
What exactly does the War Trust hope to achieve?
Tell me about their work.
With this station destroyed, it won't matter if you know.
I'm taking you into custody, General.
We'll see. [Knock him out]
Guess killing you will have to be my consolation.
But you're not. [Kill Minst]
I want to know everything about Project Siantide.
Tell me about your project.
Little good it will do you. What's ironic is that the Empire's bombardment of Taris so many years ago made Project Siantide possible.
The substance being mined from the acid lake caves is the residue of all the life-forms eradicated in the flash fires of the original Sith bombardment.
We found that when the substance is exposed to radiation from this station, it becomes a volatile but extremely powerful energy source.
What are its uses?
For what?
The sky is the limit.
I think you're playing with fire, Minst.
Sounds dangerous.
You have to play with fire if you wish to control it.
I'm not impressed.
Who cares?
How simpleminded you are, Sith.
With Siantide cells, common blasters will deliver like a turbo laser. Republic starships will fly circles around Imperial ships in combat.
This station held the only equipment that could convert the substance. So, now the Empire will be outmatched on every battlefield.
Very few people get to die with a smile.
You're lucky. [Kill Minst]
Perhaps the Empire can convince you to recreate your work for us.
You're ours. [Knock him out]
Moff Hurdenn, come in. I have a prisoner. Send men to this location to pick up General Minst.
Ah, yes, immediately, my lord. What do you want me to do with him?
He is my personal guest. No harm is to come to him.
Treat him well.
Add him to my collection of Republic generals.
Stick him with Frellka.
Just hold him for me.
Do nothing.
Get your best man to try to pry Generals Durant and Faraire's location from him.
Interrogate him.
Yes, of course, it will be done.
It's time for you to die!
Heard enough! [Kill Minst]
Ugh....
Vault code sequence cross-checking....
[You insert the vault code sequencer.]
Vault code sequence arming....
The reactor core will self-destruct in sixty seconds....
Vault code sequence initiated.
Sure hope that imposter was right and that thing takes less than a minute.
The imposter's estimate had better be right. If this takes more than a minute, we'll be caught in the explosion.
Terrific. If that imposter was wrong about how much time this will take, we'll be blown to bits.
If the imposter was wrong about the time, we're in trouble.
False clan leader says one minute to get in. One minute is all we have.
Just sit tight. I'm sure this will work.
Patience.
Your constant chatter isn't helping.
Shut up.
Sorry. I always get chatty when I'm about to die.
Of course, my lord.
I just don't like being at the mercy of Republic tech.
Sorry. I'm just a little nervous.
We want to fight, not talk!
I'll hunt him down if this goes badly.
He'll pay if he lied.
Yeah, sure, once we survive a reactor core implosion.
We might have trouble doing that from the grave, my lord.
I'm sure the desire for vengeance will protect us through the blast.
If this goes badly, we won't be in any condition to hunt anyone.
We kill from beyond the grave!
The reactor core will self-destruct in forty-five seconds....
Men, the enemy is accessing the fallout vault. Defeat the Sith, and we can weather the explosion inside the vault!
Oh, perfect. Now we've got company.
My lord, to complicate the matter, it seems we've been spotted.
At least we won't be twiddling our thumbs! More fools to slaughter!
Master, it looks like we have a fight on our hands.
Good, we don't have to sit idly--we kill more enemy now!
Enjoy the risk.
